ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Great course, and a nice complement to Comparative I.
You should take this if you want to take the comparative exam.
Very useful overview of the canon of Comparative Politics, very heavy workload and not brilliant class discussions. But useful nonetheless.

It's an overview of many of the main topics in comparative politics and will prepare you for the comprehensive exams. I would strongly recommend the course to anyone who plans on qualifying in comparative politics either through coursing out or by taking the exam.
A great introduction to all the major topic areas in comparative politics -- with a good mix of depth and breadth.
Only valuable if you plan on taking the Comparative Comps exam. otherwise it's too insider-baseball.
I would recommend taking the course in order to:a) gain an overview of the current CP literatureb) prepare for the CP qualifying exam.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: Very helpful for my own research.
A good introduction to the comparative politics literature, helpful for the comparative politics field exam
My knowledge of comparative politics has improved dramatically thanks to this course and it will help me tie my specific research into broader questions and literatures.
An essential course for anyone intending to specialize in comparative politics.
Not a bad course but not a great course.
The course provided a good overview of the current CP literature.
